sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using iterative methods
message_1:
The system of linear equations 
x - 2y + 3z = 9 
2x + y + z = 8 
3x + y - 2z = 1 
needs to be solved using the Jacobi iterative method. With the initial approximation x⁰ = [1, 1, 1]ᵀ, compute the approximate solution after one iteration.
message_2:
To use the Jacobi iterative method, we first rewrite the given system of linear equations in the form x = Dx + b, where D is a diagonal matrix, and b is a constant vector. In this case, we have:

D = | 1  0  0 |
      | 0  1  0 |
      | 0  0 -2 |

b = | 9 |
      | 8 |
      |-1 |

Now, we apply the Jacobi iterative formula:

x^(k+1) = D^(-1) (b - (A - D)x^(k))

where A is the matrix of coefficients of the given system, x^(k) is the current approximation, and x^(k+1) is the next approximation.

A = | 1 -2  3 |
      | 2  1  1 |
      | 3  1 -2 |

x^(0) = | 1 |
            | 1 |
            | 1 |

Now, let's compute the next approximation x^(1):

x^(1) = D^(-1) (b - (A - D)x^(0))

A - D = | 0 -2  3 |
             | 2  0  1 |
             | 3  1  0 |

(A - D)x^(0) = | 0 -2  3 |   | 1 |   | 1 |
                          | 2  0  1 | x | 1 | = | 3 |
                          | 3  1  0 |   | 1 |   | 4 |

b - (A - D)x^(0) = | 9 | - | 1 | = | 8 |
                         | 8 | - | 3 | = | 5 |
                         |-1 | - | 4 | = |-5 |

D^(-1) = | 1  0  0 |
              | 0  1  0 |
              | 0  0 -1/2 |

D^(-1) (b - (A - D)x^(0)) = | 1  0  0 |   | 8 |   | 8 |
                                            | 0  1  0 | x | 5 | = | 5 |
                                            | 0  0 -1/2 |   |-5 | = | 2.5 |

So, the approximate solution after one iteration is:

x^(1) = | 8 |
            | 5 |
            | 2.5 |
